page.title: 18Dorset Farms 2
page.content: Down End Farm Down End Farm has 154 acres and is divided into 4 fields. It is totally different from the others because it is part of a big pig-farming company. They grow maize on the land for cow farmers but have 670 sows and 7000 young pigs. 10 people work there. They have special food for the piglets, and all of them are kept in sheds with air-conditioning. To work or even see the pigs you have to shower.It is part of a scheme called 'Minimal Disease.' They feed their pigs on the: remains from corn flakes " " beer etc <50,000 gallons " " cheese (whey) per week> " " dog biscuits and crushed barley.
